intro: Alepidea cathcartensis, commonly known as the Natal umbrella tree, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive umbrella-like inflorescence. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil types. Alepidea cathcartensis is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
